dhp183:4: Note the use of the plural here, indicating that this is teaching not just of one Buddha but of all Buddhas.
dhp184:1:
The
 word _khantī_ encompasses patience, endurance, tolerance, acceptance, 
and forgiveness. The word _tapo_ (_tapas_), translated commonly as “austerity”, also has a broader meaning of spiritual practice in general.
dhp185:2: The meaning of the term _Pātimokkha_ here is debatable. While in later times this word came to be used specifically to mean the lists of monastic rules, in the earliest phase of Buddhist history it may have had a broader connotation of moral conduct for all practitioners, including laypeople.
